bwwExcerpt: For those who have never seen an Ivo van Hove production, the coups de théâtres will be very coup-y: the masterful choreography of bodies and cameras, the densely layered music and sound (by Eric Sleichim), scenes shot live right outside the theater, the use of video for clever misdirection of the eye - particularly in a bloody climax near the end. If you've been following the director's output for years, however, all these signature gestures will be less revelatory. But let's face it, audiences
